questions.question: What practice automates the integration of code changes from multiple contributors?
questions.explanation: Continuous Integration (CI) automatically builds and tests code changes whenever developers commit to version control.

questions.question: What containerization platform packages applications with dependencies?
questions.explanation: Docker is a containerization platform that packages applications and their dependencies into portable containers.

questions.question: What orchestration system manages containerized applications?
questions.explanation: Kubernetes is a container orchestration platform that automates deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

questions.question: What practice automatically deploys every change that passes tests to production?
questions.explanation: Continuous Deployment automatically releases every change that passes all stages of the production pipeline.

questions.question: What automation server is commonly used for CI/CD pipelines?
questions.explanation: Jenkins is an open-source automation server used to build, test, and deploy applications in CI/CD pipelines.

questions.question: What practice manages infrastructure using code and version control?
questions.explanation: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) manages and provisions infrastructure through machine-readable definition files rather than manual processes.

questions.question: What tool automates configuration management and application deployment?
questions.explanation: Ansible is an automation tool for configuration management, application deployment, and task automation.

questions.question: What collects and analyzes data about application performance?
questions.explanation: Monitoring continuously collects metrics and logs to track application performance, availability, and health.

questions.question: What deployment strategy gradually rolls out changes to subset of users?
questions.explanation: Canary Deployment releases changes to a small subset of users before rolling out to everyone, reducing risk.

questions.question: What practice ensures code changes are always in a deployable state?
questions.explanation: Continuous Delivery ensures software can be reliably released at any time, keeping it in a production-ready state.
